resources.string:
1. Support the baby's head: Babies have limited head
 and neck control in the early months. Place one hand
 under the baby's head and neck to support it properly.

 2. Slide one hand under the baby's bottom: Gently
 slide your other hand under the baby's bottom to
 provide additional support. Make sure to keep your
 hand flat and use your arm for support.

 3. Lift the baby: Use your arms, keeping them close to
 your body, to lift the baby smoothly and slowly.
 Maintain a firm but gentle grip on the baby to ensure
 stability.

 4. Hold the baby against your chest: Bring the baby
 close to your body, nestling them against your chest.
 This position promotes bonding and provides a
 sense of security for the baby.

 5. Check the baby's position: Ensure the baby's face
 is visible, and they can breathe freely. The baby's
 head should rest comfortably against your shoulder
 or the crook of your arm, with their chin lifted slightly.

 6. Secure the baby's body: Use your arm and hand to
 provide support to the baby's body, keeping them
 close to you. Avoid any sudden or jerky movements.

 7. Maintain eye contact and talk soothingly: Babies
 find comfort in seeing your face and hearing your
 voice. Maintain eye contact and speak softly to
 provide reassurance and build a connection.

 8. Be mindful of your movements: When carrying a baby,
 move slowly and gently. Avoid sudden twists or turns
 that could jolt the baby or make them feel unstable.
